description.plain:
Artist Julius Dubose (b. December 6, 1995), better known by the stage name A Boogie wit da Hoodie (or simply A Boogie) is an American rapper and singer from the Highbridge neighborhood of The Bronx.

The “A” in his name is short for his first name, Boogie is a reference to his hometown, which is sometimes known as the Boogie Down Bronx, and “wit da Hoodie” simply comes from him constantly wearing hoodies.

A Boogie first rose to fame with the success of his underground hit “My Shit,” which was released on January 17, 2016. In February of that year, A Boogie released his debut mixtape, Artist. Then, in May, he and Don Q released Highbridge the Label: The Takeover, Vol. 1, a collaborative mixtape.

A Boogie released The Bigger Artist, his debut studio album, on September 29, 2017.

On June 20, 2018, A Boogie released his debut EP, International Artist.

On December 21, 2018, A Boogie released Hoodie SZN, his sophomore studio album, which topped the Billboard 200 Albums Chart.

On Valentine’s Day of 2020, A Boogie released his third studio album ‘Artist 2.0’–commemorating the four year anniversary of its prequel–which found him tapping into his melody-driven romantic side.

songs.embed_content: Read “Still Think About You” by A Boogie wit da Hoodie on Genius

description.plain:
In an interview with Genius, A Boogie explained what inspired this song:


The moment I wrote this song, I was in the process of thinking about this girl that did me wrong. I started going out with this girl for about four months. She told me she was pregnant, so I’m thinking it’s mine. At first I was buggin’ like, “Damn, I don’t want a baby.”

And then one day she disappeared on me, then I seen a picture with her and some nigga, she was pregnant and shit. I was just thinking like, “Damn this bitch really did me wrong.”


Although the song tells the story of getting angry after getting played by a sweetheart, in the end A Boogie’s romantic side shines through as he repeats the song title over and over: “I still think about you…”

In an interview with XXL, A Boogie described this track as “one of the five hits” on his debut mixtape, Artist. Revolt described it as an example of A Boogie’s “rare versatility and style that is freeflowing and allows for him to dance over […] lines of R&B”.

description.plain:
Track six off A Boogie Wit Da Hoodie’s debut mixtape, Artist, tells the story of Highbridge, a neighborhood in the Bronx, where A Boogie grew up. Throughout the song, A Boogie compares the neighborhood to a “Jungle”—an idea he came up with when reflecting upon the problems of his neighborhood:

One day I was thinking like this is dead-ass the jungle. There was mad shit going on when I was making the song.

description.plain:
“Timeless” is A Boogie flowing over a smooth R&B-influenced instrumental produced by Toronto’s very own, Jaegen.

A preview of the cut was included on DJ SpinKing’s mixtape, “For the Culture,” whereas the full song made its way to A Boogie’s project, “TBA,” released October 28, 2016.

songs.full_title: No Promises by A Boogie wit da Hoodie
songs.embed_content: Read “No Promises” by A Boogie wit da Hoodie on Genius

description.plain:
On “No Promises,” A Boogie Wit Da Hoodie raps about a failed relationship and how he still treated the woman well. He talks about the spoils and setbacks of a famous lifestyle, such as not being able to make or keep promises and having desires of having one expensive watch over the other.

Boogie also touches on a fan of Boogie’s named Savannah who was shot and killed at his concert in Tim Faulkner Gallery in Louisville, KY. in March 2017:

Savannah just wanted to see me perform
And got hit over stupid shit
I woke up and saw the shit right on my phone
They don’t know who the shooter is

The song samples “Deep End” by the up and coming R&B group THEY. and a portion of the verse is recycled from his 2017 XXL Freshman Cypher.

description.plain:
“Look Back at It” sees A Boogie interpolate the flow and rhythm from Michael Jackson’s “You Rock My World" throughout the verses and “Remember the Time” during the post-chorus.

Peculiarly, a snippet released on Boogie’s Instagram dates back to December 21, 2017, almost a year before the song’s full release.

songs.full_title: Say A' by A Boogie wit da Hoodie

description.plain:
“Say A'” is the third single from A Boogie’s debut studio album The Bigger Artist. It is the first single without a featured artist. The track is produced by Ness, an in-house producer and A Boogie’s label-mate at Highbridge the Label.

The piano is used generously in the instrumental, as well as in much of the rest of A Boogie’s discography. Keys are depicted on the cover art for both of A Boogie’s prior projects: Artist and TBA.

“Say A'” is the third single from A Boogie’s debut studio album The Bigger Artist. It is the first single without a featured artist. The track is produced by Ness, an in-house producer and A Boogie’s label-mate at Highbridge the Label.

The piano is used generously in the instrumental, as well as in much of the rest of A Boogie’s discography. Keys are depicted on the cover art for both of A Boogie’s prior projects: Artist and TBA.

description.plain:
On “Just Like Me,” A Boogie teams up with Atlanta rapper Young Thug for a sweet song where the two artists adress their love and desire for their significant other.

The track marks the second collaboration between Thug and A Boogie, following DJ Esco’s song “Showed You.”

songs.full_title: Stalking You by A Boogie wit da Hoodie
songs.embed_content: Read “Stalking You” by A Boogie wit da Hoodie on Genius

description.plain: Boogie speaks about missing his ex and watching everything she does on social media. He wants to call her but knows that she will not answer her phone after all that they have been through in the past. He stalks her knowing in his heart that he still loves her but doesn’t want to admit it.
